author: cbernet
body:
Hello, 

Here is the most recent version of the heppy analysis framework. 

Another pull request will follow shortly for 81X. 

More changes are expected in the following weeks from the CERN group (@gpetruc) and the VHbb group (@arizzi) but we should first merge this one.

Indeed, even though the number of commits is small, heppy has been synced manually -- a painful process -- with the most recent developments from the FCC collaboration, and this pull request is actually very important. Among other things, one can now find in PhysicsTools/HeppyCore: 

- a test suite with fairly good coverage (~100 unit tests). 
- reference documentation: http://fcc-support-heppy.web.cern.ch/fcc-support-heppy/moduleIndex.html (still working on it)
- papas : a generic particle flow simulation similar to Delphes
- the particles package, which contains a set of particle-like classes that can be used transparently in different experiments
- hooks to read the LCIO event data model (ILC, CLIC)

Best, 

Colin.
